text: __NOTOC__ Ludwig Wolff (3 April 1893 – 9 November 1968) was a general in the Wehrmacht of Nazi Germany during World War II who commanded the XXXIII Army Corps. He was a recipient of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves. ==Awards and decorations== * Iron Cross (1914) 2nd Class (November 1914) &1st Class (28 June 1917)Thomas 1998, p. 459. * Clasp to the Iron Cross (1939) 2nd Class (13 May 1940) &1st Class (18 May 1940) * German Cross in Gold on 8 February 1942 as Generalmajor in the 22 Infanterie-DivisionPatzwall & Scherzer 2001, p. 522. * Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves ** Knight's Cross on 26 May 1940 as Oberst and commander of Infanterie-Regiment 192Fellgiebel 2000, p. 366. ** Oak Leaves on 22 June 1942 as Generalmajor and commander of 22 Infanterie-Division (Luftlande) 55Fellgiebel 2000, p. 54. ==References== ===Citations=== ===Bibliography=== * * * Category:1893 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Military personnel from Chemnitz Category:People from the Kingdom of Saxony Category:Generals of Infantry (Wehrmacht) Category:German military personnel of World War I Category:Recipients of the clasp to the Iron Cross, 1st class Category:Recipients of the Gold German Cross Category:Recipients of the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves Category:German prisoners of war in World War II held by the United States Category:Reichswehr personnel
title: Ludwig Wolff (general)
